titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Talman Family Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by M. Freeman Cocroft

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday January 8, 2019 at 08:22

did.unittitle: Talman family papers

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: Deeds, leases, miscellaneous documents, and some correspondence of the Talman family, early settlers of Guilford, Connecticut.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Talman Family Papers (MS 662). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in two series: I. General Documents. II. Deeds and Land Transactions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains papers dating from 1683 to 1866 which pertain to the Talman family, early settlers of Guilford, Connecticut. The papers are divided into two series, the contents of which are arranged alphabetically by author.

The first series, GENERAL DOCUMENTS, contains fourteen items not related to land holdings or transfers. Included are, for instance, a bond for a slave, an apprenticeship agreement, a statement of early 18th-century Puritan religious belief entitled "Doctrine of Faith," inventories, and a few pieces of correspondence.

Series II, DEEDS AND LAND TRANSACTIONS, consists of thirty-three deeds to land in and around Guilford, as well as nine other documents dealing with land transactions. Included are certificates, memoranda, and correspondence concerning land.
These papers were purchased by Yale University in 1948.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Four generations of the Talman family are represented in these papers: Peter Talman (1658-1726) and his wife Anna (Wright) Walstone Talman; their son Ebenezer (1692-1770); their grandchildren Peter III and Sarah (Talman) Curtis; and their great-grandson Peter, Jr., and his wife Ruth. The first Peter, born in Newport, Rhode Island, on March 22, 1658, was a physician who settled in Guilford in 1683. He married Anna Wright in 1683 and died on July 6, 1726. His son, Ebenezer, was also a doctor. (See A History of the Plantation of Menunkatuck and of the Original Town of Guilford, Connecticut by Bernard C. Steiner.)

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator(s) of this collection are in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

did.unittitle: GENERAL DOCUMENTS

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Talmans were among the early settlers of Guilford, Connecticut. All the documents in this collection are believed to be connected with this family. The dates of these documents range from 1683-1866.

The 14 documents in this series are concerned either with legal matters unrelated to land or with no legal affairs at all. Typical documents include a bond for a slave; correspondence that makes no mention of land transactions; an apprenticeship agreement; a paper entitled "Doctrine of Faith," which is a statement of early 18th-century Puritan religious belief.

DEEDS AND LAND TRANSACTIONS

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The 42 documents in this series consist mainly of 33 deeds. The remaining documents include such items as three certificates for land and a letter that mentions how some land was disposed of in a will. One deed is for land in Branford, Connecticut, but all the other deeds are for land in Guilford and North Guilford.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Note: Peter and Anna Talman were husband and wife. The Peter Talman of this deed is Peter Talman I.
